context: I failed to listen when you needed to talk
letter:
Dear [Son's Name],

I hope this note finds you well. I am writing to express my sincerest apologies for not being fully present when you needed to talk. I recognize that there are moments when having someone to listen can make a significant difference, and I regret that I was unable to provide that support for you when it mattered most.

It was never my intention to dismiss your feelings or concerns, and I deeply regret any hurt my lack of attentiveness may have caused you. Your thoughts and emotions are important to me, and I want you to know that I am here for you. I am committed to doing better and ensuring that I am more available and receptive in the future.

Please know that I value our relationship and the trust you place in me. I am always willing to listen and support you when you need it. Thank you for your understanding, and I hope we can move forward together.

With all my love,

[Your Name]
